greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = Product (p_j^k_j) then a(n) = Product (pi(p_j)*k_j), where pi() = A000720.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
formula: a(p^k) = A000720(p)*k where p is a prime.
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(f=factor(n)); for (k=1, #f~, f[k,1] = primepi(f[k,1])*f[k,2]; f[k, 2] = 1); factorback(f); \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 06 2018
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, May 06 2018
